questions.question: Many people look _____ to the weekends.
The baby _____ crying since morning.
I hope the weather _____ fine for the picnic.
Her aunt _____ her a lovely necklace for her birthday.
Swimming on a full stomach can be _____ for you.
Last evening the man _____ to his girlfriend.
The boy was _____ by a dog.
After all the hype, the movie _____ to be boring.
Her parents were not happy with her _____ of friends.
I will _____ the doctor this evening.
She _____ be hungry after all that running.
Rice and curry _____ a tasty dinner.
questions.answer: D (Compound subject treated as singular 'makes'? Or plural 'make'. Rice and curry is often considered a single dish, taking singular. So 'makes'. Option B is 'makes'. Option D is 'make'. "Rice and curry makes a tasty dinner".  B).

questions.question: We _____ be considerate towards our neighbours.
Wood _____ on water.
He has _____ friends. He is an introvert.
I have to wake up early. I must _____ right now.
questions.answer: B (Hit the hay = go to sleep).

questions.question: I haven't had fun in ages. I have _____ right now.
options: a) two for the price of one
b) done all in a day's work
c) too much on my plate
d) been hit by the weather
questions.answer: C (Too much on my plate = too busy/occupied).

questions.question: After winning the contest, she wouldn't talk... She now walks with her _____.
He watched _____ as the water swept away his car.
Getting my car fixed is going to cost me _____ as the engine has completely blown.
options: b) an arm and a leg
d) a drop in the ocean
questions.answer: B (An arm and a leg = very expensive).

questions.question: The job might seem confusing... but you will soon _____.
options: d) put all your eggs in one basket

questions.question: I am tired of _____ here.
He _____ to Delhi yesterday.
The choir will sing the next hymn. (File 55 - Passive)
options: a) The next hymn is being sung.
b) The next hymn will be sung by the choir.
c) The choir shall sing the next hymn.
d) The next hymn is sung by the choir.

questions.question: Our costumes were being made by Jimmy. (File 55 - Active)
options: a) Jimmy is making our costumes.
b) Jimmy will make our costumes.
c) Our costumes is being made.
d) Jimmy was making our costumes.

questions.question: I _____ here.
Directions: Supply the most appropriate tense of the verbs. Tom _____ landscapes in modern designs.
He _____ several awards for his designs.
questions.answer: B (Likely fact/general truth, or C if context is past, but B fits the "Tom paints" tense flow).

questions.question: He _____ his first picture just one year ago.
He _____ over fifty pictures since then.
questions.answer: B (Or "has sold", but option B "sells" is the only grammatically viable simple verb, though Present Perfect "has sold" would be ideal. Given options, if "sells" is the only finite verb, it might be the choice, but standard grammar demands Present Perfect. Wait, looking at options for Q39: a) sell, b) sells, c) sold, d) selling. None is Present Perfect. "Sold" is simple past. "Sells" is present. Let's look at Q42. Q42 has "has had". Q39 might be "sold" if the timeline is narrative. Let's re-evaluate Q39 options provided in image. The image says: "He ____ over fifty pictures since then." Options: a) sell, b) sells, c) sold, d) selling. "Sold" is likely expected here as a past narrative, even though "since" usually triggers perfect tense. However, "has sold" is not an option. "Sold" is the best fit among bad options).  C (Best available option).

questions.question: Dick _____ in a bank, but he doesn't any more.
He _____ his job at the bank two years ago.
He _____ several different jobs since then.
He _____ a job for three months.
questions.answer: B (He looked for... implies a past duration).

questions.question: Betty _____ to play tennis when she was fourteen.
She _____ every summer since that time.
questions.answer: B (Habitual action continuing from past: "has played" would be ideal, but "plays" indicates current habit).
